questions.question: If she studies hard, she _____ the exam.
What is the correct structure of a first conditional sentence?
options: If + present simple, will + base verb
If + past simple, would + base verb
If + present perfect, will + base verb
If + base verb, will + present simple
questions.answer: If + present simple, will + base verb

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence.
options: If we will be late, the teacher gets angry.
If we are late, the teacher will get angry.
If we being late, the teacher gets angry.
If we be late, the teacher will get angry.
questions.answer: If we are late, the teacher will get angry.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'If they _____ the tickets now, they will get a discount.'
Which of the following is NOT a correct use of the first conditional?
options: If it rains, we will cancel the picnic.
If you help me, I will finish faster.
If he had time, he will join us.
If she sees the message, she will reply.
questions.answer: If he had time, he will join us.

questions.question: Choose the best option: 'If I don't hurry, I _____ the train.'
Identify the conditional type: 'If you touch that wire, you will get shocked.'
What will happen if you mix red and blue?
Select the correct sentence using the first conditional.
options: If he forgets his keys, he would be locked out.
If he will forget his keys, he is locked out.
If he forgets his keys, he will be locked out.
If he forgetting his keys, he will be locked out.
questions.answer: If he forgets his keys, he will be locked out.
